title: Resolution on Regularisation of Gramin Dak Sevaks and Inclusion of GDS in the 8th CPC Purview.
description:
ALL INDIA GRAMIN DAK SEVAKS UNION (AIGDSU)

Central Head Quarters, Padam Nagar, Delhi-110007.

 

President: B. Venkateshwarlu.

Off. General Secretary: C.K. Subramani

 

Ref No.: GDS/CHQ/CWC/1/3/2025                                    Date: 09-12-2025

 

To,

 

The Secretary,

Department of Posts, Dak Bhawan, New Delhi-110001

 

Sub: Resolution on Regularisation of Gramin Dak Sevaks and Inclusion of GDS in the 8th CPC Purview.

 

Respected Madam,

              The Central Working Committee of AIGDSU, in its meeting held at New Delhi on 4th December 2025, adopted a resolution urging the Government and the Department to regularise all Gramin Dak Sevaks and to bring them under the purview of the 8th Central Pay Commission.Postal Savings Schemes

 

               The Committee has clearly recorded that GDS continue to perform core departmental duties across rural India, yet remain outside the framework of regular service conditions, social security, and wage revision mechanisms.

 

                The approved resolution is enclosed for consideration, as the matter carries significant implications for service delivery, workforce stability, and the welfare of lakhs of GDS who sustain postal operations in remote areas.

 

We, therefore, request necessary action for inclusion of GDS in the 8th CPC and steps towards full regularisation.

 

With high regards,

 

Yours faithfully,

 

C. K. Subramani

Off. General Secretary

title: Department of Posts has been taking multiple measures to prevent any potential leakage of revenue
description:
Series of meetings have been held at different levels including a meeting chaired by the Minister of State for Communications
Posted On: 10 DEC 2025 4:53PM by PIB Delhi
A series of meetings have been held at different levels including a meeting chaired by the Minister of State for Communications. Operational and fraud risks in different services have been identified based on available information. Broadly, deficiency in postage realization, use of used up/ fake stamps, no or less postage in pre-paid articles, infringement of conditions in registered news paper etc.

The following steps have been taken to prevent any potential leakage of revenue: -

i) Based on volumes of mail and parcel bookings and assessment of financial services for vulnerability to leakage of revenue, post offices have been categorised to strengthen oversight.

(ii) Preventive processes to avoid recurrence of any frauds through analysis of identified modus operandi have been introduced.

(iii) An alerts-based risk management system has been strengthened.

The Department is continuously strengthening oversight and risk management with use of technology and data analytics and transactions driven alerts to prevent any potential loss and deviation from prescribed processes, creating end to end online processes to grant licence to registered news paper etc.

Strengthening of oversight through corrective and preventive measures is an ongoing process. Necessary steps with the help of experts and advanced technology are being progressively taken by the Department to improve its revenue performance.

This information was given by the Minister of State for Communications and Rural Development Dr. Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar in a written reply to a question in the Lok Sabha today.

*****
